definition[0]: a large boat used for carrying people or goods across the sea
definition[2]: a ship that carries people rather than goods
definition[3]: a large ship that people have holidays on
definition[4]: a large ship that sails long distances across the ocean
definition[5]: a ship that makes short regular journeys between two places
example[5]: The ferry operates daily between Hull and Zeebrugge.
definition[6]: a ship that carries goods rather than people
definition[7]: a ship that carries goods in special containers which can be put on trucks
definition[8]: a large ship that carries goods
definition[10]: a very large ship that carries oil
definition[11]: a ship that carries goods on a river or canal
definition[12]: a military ship with guns, used in a war
definition[13]: the largest type of ship used in war, with very big guns on it
definition[14]: a military ship that planes can fly from or land on
definition[15]: a small fast military ship with guns, often used for protecting battleships
definition[16]: a small fast ship with guns on it, often used in shallow water near a coast
definition[17]: a military ship that can stay under water
definition[18]: a military ship used for removing bombs from under water
definition[19]: to send goods somewhere by ship, plane, truck etc
example[7]: A new engine was shipped over from the US.
definition[20]: to make a piece of computer equipment or software available for people to buy
example[8]: They’re now shipping their long-awaited new anti-virus software.
example[9]: Both products are due to ship at the beginning of June.
definition[21]: to order someone to go somewhere
example[10]: He was shipped off to a juvenile detention center.
definition[22]: a particular position or job, or the time during which you have it
example[11]: He was offered a professorship  (=the job of professor).
example[12]: in Mr Major’s premiership  (=when he was prime minister)
example[14]: Private car ownership has almost doubled in the past ten years.
definition[25]: all the people in a particular group
example[18]: a magazine with a readership of 9,000 (=with 9,000 readers)
definition[26]: Safe Home Income Plans association; an official organization in Britain that represents and controls companies who provide Hips
example[20]: The island’s waste is taken by ship to the mainland.
definition[27]: to send or carry something by ship
example[21]: I had my car shipped out to me.
definition[28]: to send or deliver something by road, train, or air
example[22]: A new computer was shipped to him within two weeks.
definition[29]: to make goods, especially computer software, available for people to buy or use
example[23]: The software giant declined to release the number of units its subsidiary has shipped.
